events.message: The insured reported a car collision that occurred yesterday afternoon on Elm Street involving another vehicle.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on the keywords describing the vehicle collision incident.
An agent with expertise in auto collision claims has been assigned to handle the insured's case for efficient processing.
Acknowledgment of the claim was sent to the insured confirming receipt and commencing the evaluation process for their vehicle accident.
The insurance company requested the insured to submit the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates to proceed.
The insured submitted all required documents including the official police report, repair shop estimates, and accident photographs.
Investigation into the accident circumstances and damage estimates started as per standard protocol for auto accident claims.
The investigation report was completed, confirming the insured was not at fault and the damage assessment matched submitted estimates.
A settlement proposal covering all repair costs and vehicle rental fees was sent to the insured for approval.
The insured responded positively, agreeing with the proposed settlement amount and expressing satisfaction with the claims process.
The claim was officially approved following the insured's acceptance of the settlement, confirming all terms were met.
The payment for repairs and rental reimbursement was processed and issued to the insuredâ€™s designated bank account.
The claim file was closed after successful payment and confirmation of repairs completion by the insured.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived securely for future reference in compliance with company policy.
